caption: Outdoor dinning. Friendly staffs. Good food.

The place was so cute! Great mood lighting, precautions for covid. Limited seating and dividers in place. Music is lovely and the staff is soo chill and welcoming! Now on to the good part, the food was so delicious. Had the Artichoke Dip, WOW! It was so delicious and the bread was so fresh!  Also had a Charcuterie board cheese and meats were fresh! Tried the special based on the recommendation from the server it was a vegan Eggplant Dish and again soooo delicious!  The drinks were specially crafted and were light so no overly sugary taste.  Overrall I will back loved this spot!  OHHHHH most important part it's Cash Only, they do have a ATM, surcharge is $2.50.

I wanted to find a nice spot for Sunday Brunch, and I was pleasantly surprised to find Les Enfants! The atmosphere was lovely, great playlist and attentive staff. I got a croissant and French toast with a latte and all of which tasted fresh. The only downside to me was that it’s cash only, however they have an atm.

Excellent food, excellent service.  We had the mushroom risotto and the salmon with lentils.  Both dishes were perfect.  And even during the pandemic, they have live music on Thursday and Saturday nights.   We will definitely come back soon

The best little neighborhood spot - a place for regulars to gather and for anyone to feel as though they’ve made a “discovery”- the best of old and current New York.  Ample outdoor seating, cocktails served in glassware - a must for me, during these plastic cup COVID times.
Beautiful little french restaurant hidden away in a quiet alley way. Great food and price.

We went there for brunch today and we were happy customers. Good food and good cocktails, and friendly service. Of note: it is the first time we had actual galettes, or « crêpes au sarrasin », i.e. savory crêpes made with 100% buckwheat flour,  in NYC.

The outdoor seating is charming and well-protected, as the whole street is closed to traffic. Twinkling lights, Fermob chairs, experienced/knowledgeable/engaging wait staff all make this place a gem. The menu is typical French - steak tartare can be ordered as an appetizer or main (the main dish comes with salad and crunchtacular hand-cut frites). Wines by the glass are lovely and priced fairly.  The vibe is laid back and it is easy to see why this is a local favorite to many.
Certainly a spot worth trying, the food is great and well prepared, the rates are convenient and it is constantly clean there. 5 stars.

What a surprise. Nestled under some very uncertain scaffolding (but this is the LES; all scaffolding looks uncertain!) lies this absolute gem of a restaurant. The menu is simple yet authentic, featuring dishes just that bit more ‘French’ than most that attempt the cuisine. Just what we had hoped! The quality and presentation was second to none - especially under such trying circumstances. The outdoor seating has an authentic ‘rive gauche’ touch. Service was charming and efficient. Look out for the rather Pavlovian pass-through from the kitchen. Do not miss out on this one.
The kind of restaurant I think of when I am sighing over how much I miss a bustling excellent restaurant at nine on a Friday night

Just updating this review to reflect our recent two visits in the new outdoor dining world.  Whether the special “poulet chasseur” or the regular menu like steak/moules frites or duck confit, Les Enfants is still delivering well executed food at great values in a warm setting. And the outdoor setting and live music are a great bonus.  Go and enjoy, not only the great meal and experience, but supporting an important part of the neighborhood and New York community.  Stefan and team always deliver excellent service, food and drink at great value in an relaxed atmosphere that always makes us feel like we are at home in the best neighborhood cafes and gathering places in France.  And Les enfants delices next store is great for takeaway, lunch or a quick bite.  Glad we have such restauranteurs, professionals and citizens that invest in creating community through food and place.

The food was spectacular as was the service. Went with a friend and we shared food. We ordered the Moules Dijonnaise, very generous portion of mussels that came in a delicious broth. We also ordered a side of hand cut fries to go with the mussels, and the Volaille des Enfants, an exquisite chicken that's both juicy and tender, going great with the potato puree it comes with. The food was 10/10. My friend and I also very much enjoyed the ambience. While strictly following health guidelines and taking all the necessary safety precautions post-quarantine, they were still able to created a relaxed environment with great personnel and outdoor music. Great food, service, and prices. Would recommend and go again.
One of my favorite French restaurants in the city, intimate and down to earth environment. Love this place for a date night or catch up with friends.
This place is so cute. Quaint, quiet and perfect for a late lunch. Menu is small and limited. Various vegetarian & vegan options. 😋😋😋
I eat in this spot a lot since I work in the area. I have to say their service is always good and they keep the spot neat all the time. Pricing is fair and they serve big portions.
The duck was nice but remember to bring cash.

Love this place.  I can't say enough good things.  We went here after Art on Paper at Pier 36 on a whim and it was fantastic. Everyone in our group got a  different dish and the reviews were all the same....Amazing. The Foie gras was a particular favorite.
A gem of a bistro in the most unlikely of places. Great food.  Great service.
Good French food
I really loved their dishes. I always get awesome service there. The place is well organised and the staff members are always nice. I highly recommend this place.
Great place to dine.
(Translated by Google) Marion thank you  (Original) Marion merci

I am a Jersey girl currently living in the south of France. I used to love the old Les Enfants back in the day, so I was super psyched to find this new incarnation a few years back. I now make a point of having at least one meal there when I come to New York. The cocktails are delicious and not crazy expensive and the vegetarian option is always delicious. French cuisine is such a melange of flavors and cultures these days, and this restaurant certainly brings it all to New York.  Thanks you wonderful people, I look forward to the next delicious experience.

Probably one of the best french restaurants in the tri state area. The food was finished with flavors that reminded me of my time in the Vacluse in Provence. I had the cassolet - on a special menu with a delightful Gigondas. The appetizer was a charcuterie board. Will be back soon.

I LOVE this place! The food is always excellent and the menu changes regularly. Farm to table, fresh, organic. The cocktails are also delicious and seasonal. And on top of that it's a community. You'll always run into interesting people you might have already met there. Can't say enough good things about Les Enfants!
Fabulous food, great drinks, best brunch, wonderful atmosphere. A nyc gem. Do not miss it
This restaurant is one of my favorite spot in the neighborhood. The food is delicious and the service is great!

Wow! Is all that I can say. An authentic French brasserie in every regard. French owned by two artists who are both vibrant, and lovely.  The meals are prepared with health and taste wellness configured into the menu. Fair pricing, excellent cocktails, beer, and wine. They also have a creperie in the adjoining space.  The place is decorated with art that is sourced from France and perhaps a piece from the owners. With the outdoor seating, it becomes a true Bohemian sanctuary for the intellects, artists, children, adults, Film stars, yet, maintains its dignity without selling its soul with cheap gimmicks.  The soups are wonderful, as are the steak and chicken.  The owners are eco friendly and put a lot of thought into how they cook, design, and maintain the restaurant. True visionaries...
Wonderful, beautiful restaurant in the heart of the Lower East side offering an atmosphere that is so warm and welcoming. The delicious food seems to be a bonus to the gem that is Les Enfants!
Was all set to go till I saw you support planned parenthood.....not with my money.
My wife loves the moules.  They have a handful of French red wines that are all solid.  The vegetarian selection could be better, but the couple veg options are usually good.

The food was great. But the service was less then pleasant. We had reservations for 5.45,restaurant was empty yet they waitress told me we are sold out tonight so we cannot sit you until all four of you are here. Restaurant is empty still We sat down to dinner the waitress began to rush us out before we even ordered. By the time we left there were still open tables. Very upsetting to not be able too fully enjoy a good meal because we felt pushed out before we sat down.
Great night food. Great place. Good food at great prices. Everything was well organised. Staff were nice.
Good little french restaurant,  very relaxing. Good first date and romantic place.
Duck confit and short rib are two of the best dishes living in NYC. Great vibe, laid back and full of charm. This is a perfect bistro.
Great food, a touch too noisy  (but it was Friday night) and great staff.

My time here brought me back to once of the the most special times in my life.    I was reminded why I loved my time in Switzerland and my love of others who enjoy living!   PLUS, the burger with melted Brie was perfection!

(Translated by Google) Very rich food and atmosphere. I've been amazed at the live music of great jazz guitarist Rale and Alma Micic! 👏👏👏  (Original) Muy rica comida y atmósfera. Me he quedado asombrado con la música en vivo de gran guitarrista de jazz Rale y Alma Micic !👏👏👏
Excellent food, friendly service, lovely atmosphere. A real treat.
This place never disappoints. They have fantastic food for affordable prices, there are no long waits even when the place is full.
Authentic tasty well presented French food. Brilliant and friendly service. Great atmosphere. Jazz singer on the night we visited which made the evening magical.
Cocktails could be a bit larger. Should offer unlimited mimosas for the price of entrees
And adorable french bar/bistro on the lower East side. Menu is delicious, authentic and reasonably priced, staff are friendly and helpful, great vibes.

I ordered the eggs Boheme, not impressed but wasn’t bad, the menu does not appeal French to me. I asked for the cocktail of  the day they haven’t then the bar atender created one for me which was nice but I didn’t like it that much. I normally don’t like to go to places that only accepts cash. But  made an exemption. This is not a French restaurant 😐 but is a nice place if you are in the neighborhood
Nice little spot
Cozy, good food
Cozy restaurant with great food and nice atmosphere! What else you need?
Always a favorite of mine

This place deserves a 5 without a doubt! I just can't imagine someone not having an amazing experience here. Location is good, food is even better and the server who I am guessing was the owner was one of the sweetest servers I have encountered, in New York at least. Some of the one star reviews are totally unreasonable, I see that there are some people complaining about cash only but it is very clear,  on every board on every menu! And the prices aren't even bad, again for New York standards. A great little place with a soul, I just adored it! Don't forget to try their crepes.
(Translated by Google) Very good!  (Original) Très bon!

Note that this restaurant only takes CASH. Food is relatively authentic and nice. However the alcohol is absolutely disgusting (don’t ever order the specialty cocktail called filthy husband, I ordered just for name).  The waitress was extremely rude during payment. Cuz it’s only cash, my friend and I gathered some and put it on the table. She was annoyed of how scattered the money was and said “come on guys”. But seriously, aren’t you the ones requesting only cash???  What I am recommending is don’t indulge in their greedy practice. We all know the meaning of only cash.  Edit: I am changing it from one star to two since the food is fairly good  Edit reply: In response to restaurant’s reply  It’s extremely ignorant for restaurant to call out customers for giving a candid review. Just because it’s frustrating for you doesn’t mean that it’s incorrect.  I would say that I shouldn’t generalize all drinks offered at this place. However I really doubt anyone would enjoy your supposedly “most popular” filthy husband.  People are allowed to express their own discontent against culinary offerings as well as beverages. If you can’t handle criticism, maybe someone need you give you a wild awakening that your business depends on customers whose opinions shouldn’t be shunned.  “We would prefer if customers would tell the bartender or server if they disliked a drink or a dish so that the problem can be fixed at the spot”.  People tend to shy away from confrontations. That’s why online review provides a safe space for fellow customers to fully inspect a place before entering. If someone is not appreciated by a customer, no matter if it’s being “fixed” or not, it shall still be presented as some form of advice. Don’t blame customers for taking it online, blame your own place for not making it right.  As for the CASH, I would like to put it in perspective.  1. The cash scattered on the table is a direct proof of the vast inconvenience that the restaurant imposed on customers. If you have this policy that’s outright inconvenient, you have to respect and understand how customers can get flustered. A “come on guys” after we tried hard to gather all cash we can seemed extremely rude.  2. Posting your CASH only policy online is simply not the way to do it. Why would every customer check your website? It’s not some place customers usually go to in search for food.  3. Also please don’t pin CASH policy on the convenience of customers and humanitarian practices. Anyone with a sane mind knows what CASH only means. You say you care about customers’ savings. How about the transaction fees, which is not cheap, imposed on cash withdraw from the ATM (if it’s not your bank). A business that does CASH only screams “I don’t care about you”. I recommend anyone who reads this review also google why New York restaurants do cash only.  Edit: I change the ratings back to one star because I can’t reply to the owner and the restaurant’s attitude is not very pleasant.  Edit: in response to the restaurant’s second reply  Your business has the right to practice CASH only policy. It’s up to you to decide on the model (whose legitimacy is still debatable, but I won’t make any insinuation).  However, customers are also allowed to make criticism against such policy.  Also, your initial argument settles on “helping customers save marginal credit card fee”, which I called out for due to the transaction fees from ATM withdrawal. I am not sure why your second response did not mention that.  No matter what your intention was, CASH only policy is still vastly inconvenient for customers who are entitled to the right to complain.  You are right on how customers can choose where to go based on their liking. Then why am I unfair for simply letting fellow customers know that this restaurant practices such rule?  Your rudeness is evident from saying “this review is frustrating” and “maybe you can learn”
Food was delicious and service was excellent. We had a reservation for a large-ish party (roughly 8) including a toddler and they accommodated us without any issue.

Delicious food, friendly and efficient service, charming space, reasonable prices.  I question the wisdom of a cash-only policy for a restaurant at this price point, even with an ATM reportedly on site. Sure, the restaurant is not having to pay %s to the credit card companies, but frankly the cash-only policy could be a disincentive for customers because it means planning ahead, visiting an ATM, carrying a lot of cash (we had seven for dinner), and perhaps holding off on ordering those pricier bottles of wine so as not to come up short.
Wonderful ! Barmaid was very creative! Hospitality, 2nd too none ! Had impeccable 4th of July . Thanx Mademoiselle!

Horrible waitstaff... The woman kept being rude to my kids, not listening to them. Faked being nice to us and humiliated my kids and my family thinking we would be amused by it. Food took a horribly long time and was decent but definitely not worth the price. Waitress ended up kicking us to another table to “make room”... Will definitely not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Stay out of this place.

The food and service were both excellent.  The Tartare Du Bled was absolutely fantastic, and a great deal given the quality/amount.  The cocktails were quite good, and the service was both fast and very nice/pleasant.I'd highly recommend dropping in, I'll be back just for the tartare.
I love this spot. There’s a smaller cafe next door that has ready made meals for when you’re in a hurry and they are nutritious and tasty.
It was only my first time there. Only had experience with three dishes at the table. The coffee was okay. I will give it another go this week.
Food 😋
Fantastic, great food, lovely people. Wonderful time
Nice menus, good service Had the special pate and the steak both were great
One of my favorite restaurants for great food and atmosphere.  It's off the beaten track, so not touristy at all.  The staff are awesome.

Superbly executed French bistro menu. The mussels will make you long for the life you could have had in Paris. Quiet even when full so you can hear your companions. On some Sunday evenings, an incredibly talented 3 piece band adds the perfect counterpoint to the meal. Can't say enough about this hidden East Village gem.
Excellent neighborhood French cuisine. Great wine.
The muscles on Thursday night or outrageous with the fries fried in duck fat

Absolutely amazing. I came on a Sunday for brunch with my sisters and everything was delicious. We were served by Timothy who was delightful, attentive and efficient. We loved every bite of our food. I cannot wait to make this a mainstay of all of my NY from here on out!
Small cozy place has happy hour drinks a seletion of wine and great non greasy appetizers
Wonderful staff. Food was good too.
Les Enfants is a wonderful convivial refuge from the cold cruel world. Come for an aperitif or dinner and enjoy the escape.
Not sure how a fish or muscle dish is marked “vegetarian”.
Cash only
Small venue, but really good food. So far, everything I've had here has been phenomenal. I highly recommend the open-faced egg salad sandwich with bacon. Very good!
(Translated by Google) Croque Madame was sublime! Very good!  (Original) Croque Madame was sublime! Très bon!

The drinks are good, the service is excellent, and the special curry mussels were absolutely fantastic.  I highly recommend them, alongside the olive based cocktail which comes with a blue cheese stuffed olive.  Order a baked cheese as an appetizer and enjoy a night of excellent food.  The staff is very attentive and eager to help make decisions.
Stumbled upon this place years ago and never had a bad meal. Lunch, Dinner, Happy Hour it’s all good. Easy to miss but the food is simply amazing.  If I lived closer I’d be a staple at their bar.
Great French cousin
I didnt go for food. But I went for their wine list. Absolutely delicious and the place is intimate which is what I look for.
Absolutely beaut tradit, camembert, oh Richard!, Will be back again Insanely fresh and thoughtful How thoughtful

I just love these modern and young French restaurants when the food is simple but serious, the atmosphere sort of trendy but not really, and the staff is way cooler than you could ever been. Tartare was good. They have an interesting take on the burger. Setting is nice with fun drawings on the wall.
It's a neighborhood place. I so wish it were in my neighborhood! Down to earth menu, all French wine (yay!), warm staff, great schway.  Oh yeah, delicious food (rustic French).
The food was absolutely amazing.  The staff were great!   It was a great evening.  It is cash only, but they have an ATM in the back if you forget.
Really delicious sandwiches and their lunch time soup and sandwich combo is a steal. Highly recommend

Looking for a nice and interesting breakfast in the Lower East Side, around 9 or 10 o'clock, is a real challenge. We have done that before. Be it upscale Dirty French, Public Kitchen by the celebrated chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten, or Izakaya Blue Ribbon, all the choices you usually get are 2 or 3 egg dishes, granolas, oatmeal (if you are lucky) and maybe an avocado toast. Brunches start usually at a later hour, around 11 AM. Les Enfants De Bohème is a happy exclusion. The menu offers you a lot of unusual and exciting choices, such as CROQUE MONSIEUR/MADAME, TARTARE DU BLED (steak tartare), SALMON BURGER, BOHEMIAN CHEESEBURGER, and BOHEMIAN EGGS, just to name a few. All of this in addition to the wide selections of both sweet and savory crêpes (the latters are the traditional Bretonne galette de sarrasin, made with blé noir, gluten-free buckwheat flour and served with mixed green salad). The prices are very budget friendly, the service is great, and the interior is cozy, inviting, and informal, reminiscent of a non-touristy corner bistro de quartier somewhere in Paris, off the beaten path. That was the intention of the restaurant's owner, the Parisian Stéfan Jonot, known by his previous successful restaurant ventures in the neighborhood. The restaurant is located on the corner of Henry and Jefferson streets, off the Eastern Broadway, once a hub of the Jewish communal and religious life, with numerous synagogues, small prayer houses (stiebels) of the various Eastern European hasidic groups, and the imposing building of the daily newspaper Forverts (now converted into condos). Starting from the 1980s, the area became a center of the Chinese immigrants from the southeastern China's Fujian province, and was (and still is) known as Little Fuzhou. The crime in the 1970s, 1980s, and early 1990s was rampant (so much for those lamenting the sprawling gentrification), but right now the neighborhood is enjoying a gradual revival. Please make a mental note, Les Enfants De Bohème is a cash only joint. There is an ATM available on the premises, but better off, just come in carrying some cash on you. Next door, on Jefferson St., there is a take-out place, Les Enfants Delice, offering some of the spacilaties the restaurants is known for. They do accept credit cards there, with a minimum of $10 charge. Les Enfants De Bohème used to be a part of Open Table, now the reservations are obtained via Yelp.
Amazing experience, the food and atmosphere was perfect.
Cozy, unpretentious, and delicious! It was an excellent dinner, with attentive service. A great way to enjoy a quiet Sunday evening
Excellent food and very nice staff. Second time around and I plan to keep it up!
Yummy!
The atmosphere, service, and drink selection was great! The food tasted delicious, but didn't stand out from other French restaurants I've been to in NYC. Would go again.
Excellent mussels, great vegetarian special, nice French wines, and terrific service.

One of the best meals I have had in some time. I was looking for unpretentious French fare and Les Enfants exceeded the mark. The pate was amazing as well as the mussels. Every dish was perfect. The gentleman that served us was extremely friendly, helpful and on top of his game.
A little more relaxed than the other brunch joints in the area. Highly recommended.
Hidden gem! Wine was good, with perfect steak. Good date spot for 2 people or celebration for small crowds.
Delicious food and great atmosphere. Service was spectacular.
(Translated by Google) Sliced ​​steak. I went in because it was cold and hungry, but it wasn't bad.  (Original) 스테이크 썰었습니다. 춥고 배고파서 들어갔는데 나쁘지 않았습니다.

This restaurant was perfect in every way. I called ahead to help organize a surprise for my friend, and they orchastrated it perfectly, PLUS the food and service was incredible. The duck and cod are definitely things I recommend, as well as the baked Camembert as an appetizer. I could not recommend any restaurant higher.
Fabulous, friendly staff & Tasty food!
Fantastic food. Very warm service. Laid back, local atmosphere.
Nice place good to eat
My favourite meal in New York. Hands down. Whimsical and charming decor with a lovely staff. My next trip to NY I will definitely book again. ❤️

Service was fantastic, Tim was very attentive. Food was wonderfully prepared, thoughtful portions, perfectly seasoned. Prices are very reasonable for the quality. I enjoyed the Salmon burger and my husband had the Croque Madame. Both came with a beautiful micro-greens salad dressed with a delicate vinaigrette. Loved it! Wished we had taken a picture before digging in!
Excellent service and food to match.  Tim was attentive and accommodating.

I happened to work around the area and was looking for something different and found this place. I love it! The place is very cozy and I love the decor. It’s truly a cool place. Great vibe! I tried their bohemian burger and it was perfect! This place offers discounts for local workers so I am grateful for it. The server was polite but a little slow. Space is adequate. I would highly recommend this place.Happy eating! ❤️
Cocktails, creme brulee and the tartare was delicious!
Very good food and service
Excellent cuisine with fantastic service. Highly recommend.
Go prepared. Cash only. Nice atmosphere. Good service. Food is good.
Very nice, cozy place, excellent food, friendly personal
Love love love this place. Perfect for a date or catching up with friends. The staff is great and the food is very reasonable for the quality. Don't miss it next time you're in LES
Amazing food, wine and vibe. A real gem.
Quick bite with a friend...soup was AMAZING!
Amazing.
I was expecting average food and it was really great. The waitress was also friendly and attentive. Would love to revisit.
Nice place, good vibe, but the food is always a bit salty
Food was delicious and the service was amazing. Highly recommended.

I had a 20 hour layover in new york and went here for a brunch. The food was perfect for someone who had not slept and was looking for a lighter breakfast that was still delicious! The drinks were great as well. I had a bloody Mary that was wonderful! If your looking for a nice well sized meal, nice drinks and a lovely atmosphere, this is the place to be!
The best French food in the city

Cozy and Chill.  I really enjoyed this spot, I stoped in late in hope to grab a snack and some drinks. The kitchen was closing, but Sam, who was tending the bar delivered me that news, which i was ok with, but then raced to the kitchen and asked them what they could serve me easily without firing up an oven or stove tops.   So she asked is  Charcuterie,, OK?    yeas please, thats what i was craving,  thank you so much Sam , that was a next level customer service move you did right there,  Duck Pate as well.I was extremely grateful to be accommodated due to her efforts. What a sweetheart.    I snacked on what I got and took the rest home and they have a customer for life now.   In fairness I will not put them in the position to request bites after the kitchen closes, thanks to the kitchen staff for delivering.  Inside was very cozy, with a DJ that was spinning allot of mellow gems and there was a small group of people enjoying themselves and having a good time.   Merci Beaucoup

Had a great brunch on a Saturday afternoon. Friendly but not pushy staff, and a fantastic meal for the price! Recommend the brunch deal that includes a cocktail and coffee with your brunch menu. Had the Benedict and loved the extra mustardy kick of their hollandaise.

(Translated by Google) It's a nice place ... very quiet. The food is very good. Try the french soda ... loved it. And the blue cheese burger is amazing.  (Original) Es un lugar agradable...muy tranquilo. La comida es muy buena. Probe the french soda...me encantó. Y la hamburguesa de queso azul es increible.
Have met friends & colleagues for lunch here a number of times & never tried anything that wasn't delicious. Just be warned: they're cash only (although there is an ATM on site). Highly recommend!
(Translated by Google) Excellent service, very short menu with few options, tasty food  (Original) Excelente atención , carta muy corta y con pocas opciones , la comida sabrosa

Our go-to brunch place in the neighborhood. Great French-inspired food. Still regularly eating the tartare du bled after three years. Great that they have toys for kids, and love the Legos trapped in resin in the floor too.
Cool vibe, warm and welcoming staff, and the food is incredible.
Love this place!  Always great service and cocktails.
Great food, nice ambience
Wonderful restaurant!  Delicious food and great service.
Good food and cute place

Cute French restaurant in the lower East side with very good food and drinks. The staff is super nice and my boyfriend and I got a table at the window that was open as the weather was warm. I got a duck confit with lentils and potatoes and he got a steak with asparagus and califlower puree. The duck paté was delicious too as well as the creme brulee. And reasonable price for NYC! Cash only is the only little annoyance, but there is an ATM inside the restaurant
Delish
Oh my,  what to say?  Tasty, friendly staff. Reasonable
Great food for a decent price

A gem of a place. This is a wonderful place to stop by and have brunch. we were invited by Miguel who runs to Galleries and it was right before a brilliant lecture by Geoffrey Dorfman about Milton Resnick whom he was showing in his gallery.  Great meal followed by terrific lecture beautiful work showing a different side of Milton Resnick not to be missed.  And the food is great to with great service and good prices.

(Translated by Google) Restaurant run by a French woman where you are made to feel that you are there to spend money and you get 1 or 2 words in French ç is rather disappointing. We immediately offer wine to you so when you answer that you take water at the table, it bothers .. The deceptively friendly waiter only hopes for one thing to have a good "tips" at the end of the meal. Only positive point the dish of the day was very good but very expensive.  (Original) Restaurant tenu par une française ou on vous fait sentir que vous êtes là pour dépenser de l'argent et on vous décroche 1 ou 2 mots en français ç est plutôt décevant. On vous propose tout de Suite du vin alors quand vous répondez que vous prenez de l'eau à table ça dérange.. Okayish food .... over-priced! And they do NOT accept credit cards! It is a cash-only place ... a little dingy!

I never felt satisfaction out of ordering cheeseburgers from any restaurant ever.  I hesitantly ordered the one here and it's probably the best burger I have had.  Waitress was nice and very cozy atmosphere.
Awesome service.
It made for such a lovely night, cosy and nicely decorated but not over the top, the food was decent and the service was very helpful. Would totally recommend
Really romantic, cool spot. Pleasant service and great dishes.

What a lovely time this place is. Everything from the food to the charisma of the bartender was perfect. I had the strip steak dish and tried a bunch of others. Tartare, mussles, and the kale salad were all delicious. The bartender was hilarious! Great vibes and great food in this underserved location (Two Bridges). The wine (a great Cotes Du Rhone) and cocktails were new and tasty as well. Would give 6 stars if I could.
I loveeeeeeeee this place. Such good food, such good vibes, love everything from the appetizers to entrees to the delicious chocolate mousse! AMAZING COCKTAILS!
A hidden gem! Food was great, service was great ..... And entertaining. Happy hour drinks extended for the entire night was a nice little bonus for the rest of the group
Good food, nice music, nice service!
Cozy spot, good for brunch. Only annoying thing is cash only policy
A great brunch and lunch spot. Eggs Florentine, chai latte, and good croissants.

Their coffee is great but the food wasn't. We were a big group of friends and at least 3 of our plates where returned for different reasons (overcooked, didn't taste good at all and the meet almost didnt taste like any seasoning or nothing at all ) Make sure you asked as much as you can about the food you ordered so you don't have any problems when it comes. Would probably come back for the coffee, not the foos tho. Service was OK
Cash-only, expensive, and nice.

Consistently delicious, chef knows how to make veggies pop, rarely disappointed: mussels are expeceptional, staff is wonderful, clientel friendly too. Nice music. Cool chill neighborhood  vibe. Old, young, locals, visitors all hanging.
Was super impressed with this place. It’s a little out of the way, but it’s delicious.
Very good food and a wonderful staff
Food wise, middle of the road. But love the late night opening hours and something different in the hood.

We went to this place. Food is ok, BUT after a bill of 600 dollars, we went out to smoke a cigarette outside, came back to the table and we saw what? Reset table with a "reserved" sign! It's just so RUDE!
Love the vibe and Croque Madame was delicious!
Good food, great cocktails, wonderful staff.

(Translated by Google) It looks like any other bar, but it is within my top 5 in NY for French food, really spectacular  (Original) Parece un bar cualquiera, pero está dentro de mis top 5 de NY en comida francesa, realmente espectacular
Very good brunch!

Wonderful every time, the ambience and menu is always nice. Portions are appropriate and not overwhelming - you can actually eat an appetizer, entree, and dessert without feeling sick! Great and varied meat & cheese plate, with very good cocktail bar as well. CASH ONLY (they have an ATM on premise). This place will heat up soon, get there while it's still reasonable for seating on a weekend!
Small and intimate.  Good brunch
Incredible warmth emanates from this lowkey corner bar and bistro.
Great food and great atmosphere. If you are in the area stop in for a quick drink in an authentic French atmosphere.
(Translated by Google) Just delicious!  (Original) Juste delicieux!
Great atmosphere, brilliantly tasty food.

Very cute place at the corner of Henry and Jefferson. Sat at the bar and chatted with my wonderful dancing server Megan and a friendly fellow customer. The steak tartare was exactly what I was looking for. Got tipsy from a couple cocktails (two bridges and quite strong) and the addictive bread and butter that came with the table. Will definitely be back and would recommend.
Zee best
Boefe carrots, duck confit lentils and drinks were all fantastic. I will be going back to try more of the menu, Friendly staff and great atmosphere.
Guys said happy hour : 2 drinks for one, but when the bill come, it is not. Even the barmaid refuse to apply the happy hour even if we were at the right time. Very unpleasant.
Good food and the bar is nice for a nightcap.

Go in and Just ask for Artur. Then ask Artur for a drink. Tell him you want "the Saadya". He makes the best Saadya in town. It's strong and 2 of em with knock you off your feet. Also the tartare is great.
The braised beef was delicious. Will definitely go back
Mellow vibe. Great destination spot on LES.
Best bartender ever. So friendly. Highly recommended for late night drink. The asian bartender is SOOOO HOT!!! He makes really good La Bohèm!! 👍🏻

FROM THE OWNERS: Please note that the reviews here are associated with Les Enfants Terribles, Stefan Jonot's prior restaurant at 37 Canal Street (closed 2012).  Google Maps (and Google Business) has somehow linked the old and new businesses and we are trying to detangle them. The old spot was great but the new one is even better! See for yourself... Please post new reviews for Les Enfants de Bohème in the Google map/ business listing that shows photos of the new place (not the old!). Hopefully this will get sorted soon.

Drinks review only.  Nice place to grab a drink during the day with some outdoor seating or at open air bar without the craziness of a Los Feliz. Their cocktails were great esp the caparinha. Bartender was great, really nice and friendly. There's some decent people watching but not overly so (if that makes any sense).
If you like French and spicy...........check this place out! Cozy atmosphere with quaility food! A little bit of a remote location but that adds to its touch.
full of hip, good-looking people.  funky french.  crowded most of the time - good food and good service.
If you want bottles be thrown at you by the bartender's friends, go there.... The food is great and the crowd can be fun, but the service and management is the worst in New York City
good, but not great food.  romantic setting though.
